sub_title: Project Officer for The Center for Care & Cure Technology (C3Te)
summary:
During my student years, passion for research and curiosity were my driving force in choosing my career path. On my adventures trip in science I have learned that close collaborations and the creation of synergy between technology and biomedical science are much more important. They will lead to expansion of collective knowledge leading to sustainable improvement of healthcare.

As a researcher with extensive track record in cardiac and cell biology, I’m always seeking to leverage, apply and expand my experience in the multi-disciplinary medical field. I seek to dedicate my broad experience in biomedical sciences together with my critical view into the revision, assessment and supervision of research in a new challenge.

I am passionate about supervising and coaching young researchers in their scientific careers. With my enthusiasm for science I like to inspire people and thereby continuously expanding collective knowledge aiming for sustainable improvement of healthcare. I aspire a versatile position with responsibility for the supervision and coordination in the field of biomedical or clinical research.

Specialties: team building – mediator – critical thinker – adviser - emphatic – supervising - coaching

awards.title: Hartstichting - Dr. E. Dekkerprogramma - Junior Dekker
awards.description: This personal grant for junior postdocs by the Dutch Heartfoundation provides the opportunity to start your own research and develop as a young scientist into an independent researcher. The grant is €280k for a period of 4 years.

awards.title: EMBO Short Term Fellowship
awards.description: EMBo short term Fellowships fund research exchanges of up to three months between laboratories in eligible countries. The aim is to facilitate valuable collaborations with research groups applying techniques that are unavailable in the applicant's laboratory. Short-Term Fellowships are intended for joint research work rather than consultations. The fellowships cover travel plus subsistence of the fellow only and not of dependents.

profile_positions.location: Center for Care and Cure Technology (C3Te)
profile_positions.description: The Center for Care & Cure Technology Eindhoven (C3Te) focuses on multi-disciplinary research and innovation in the field of healthcare. C3Te covers a wide range of technologies in four essential areas where electrical engineering technology can make a significant contribution: neurology, oncology, cardiology and perinatology. As a project officer I facilitate and stimulate the formation of a strategic cross-disciplinary research network to identifying new funding opportunities.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer

profile_positions.description:
Research Fellow in the cardiac regeneration field with prof. dr. Carlijn Bouten. My main focus is my personal Junior Dekker grant entitled "Combining myocardial unloading and stem cells: The next step in cardiac repair". Furthermore, I have responsibilities in PhD- and master student supervision and teaching in the area of histology and cell biological techniques. My experience in biomedical science are of value in collaborations with the Intracoronary Hypothermia-project with i.a dr. Otterspoor, and prof. dr. Pijls and in the HeartAF-project together with dr. Verberkmoes and dr. Akca, both of the Catharina Hospital Eindhoven. 


Postdoc in in the group of prof. Carlijn Bouten at the department Biomedical Engineering of the Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e) on my personal Junior Dekker grant "Combining myocardial unloading and stem cells: The next step in cardiac repair".
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Postdoc in the group of prof. Marie Jose Goumans at the department Molecular Cell Biology of the Leiden University Center. An opportunity for research collaboration strengthening and knowledge exchange in the field of cardiovascular regeneration.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description: Postdoc in in the group of prof. Carlijn Bouten at the department Biomedical Engineering of the Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e) for the  NIRM project "Myocardium in a dish". Daily supevisor and co-promotor of Ariane van Spreeuwel with Thesis "Myocardium in a dish: The influence of cellular and extracellular perturbations on cardiomyocyte contractility. Defense date: 24-11-2015.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description: Short term fellowship at the dept. Biomedical Engineering of Columbia University, New York, USA granted by the European Molecular Biology Organization (EMBO). In the group of prof.  Vunjak-Novakovic  I was  part of the cardiac tissue engineering team and I performed my project "Characterizing and mimicking the cellular microenvironment in the heart" in close collaboration with Dr. Godier-Furnemont.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Research interest: 

The role of the posterior heart field and epicardium in cardiac development. The aim of the thesis was twofold. The first line of investigation concentrated on the role of platelet-derived growth factors (PDGFs) in the development of the second heart field-derived cardiac structures, especially at the venous pole of the heart. For this purpose, expression  pattern of PDGF-A, -C and their receptor PDGFR-α in the avian heart was described. Additionally, we studied mouse embryos in which the pdgfrα gene was mutated. 

The second part was based on in vitro investigations with the focus on epicardial cells and epicardium-derived cells (EPDCs), which also originate from the second heart field at the venous pole of the heart. The role of EPDCs in the differentiation of the myocardium was studied. Secondly, the process of epithelial-to-mesenchymal transformation (EMT) in human adult epicardial cells and effect of this process on electrical conductivity was outlined. 

Supervisors: Prof.  dr. Gittenberger - de Groot & Prof. dr. Goumans

Teaching activities: 

Basic histology for biomedical and medicine students. 
Supervision of master students

Collaboration:
Laser capture microscopy experiments performed at Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson&Johnson in Beerse, Belgium under supervision of dr.  De Hoogt.
profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate

volunteer_experiences.role: Board Member of Women in Science (WISE) network
volunteer_experiences.description: At the TU/e seeks to gender equality in science and therefore female talent in higher academic positions is stimulated and promoted. The Women in Science (WISE)-network is the place where female scientists share knowledge and experiences. This network supports female scientists in their personal and scientific development.
